_exec_summary.SummaryText:
MIDWAY CO-OP: LURAY ELEVATOR

For further information contact: Alvin Webber, Branch Manager or Aaron Hackerott, Safety
Director

OUR COMPANY IS AN AGRICULTURAL RETAIL BUSINESS THAT SPECIALIZES IN GRAIN STORAGE FOR AREA PRODUCERS AS WELL AS PROVIDING THE NECESSARY INPUTS FOR GRAIN PRODUCTION. 
THIS COMPANY STRIVES TO MAINTAIN A SAFE AND HEALTHY WORK PLACE.  OUR FARMER OWNERS, MANAGERS, AND EMPLOYEES HAVE MADE EVERY EFFORT TO PLAN THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.

THE LURAY ELEVATOR IS A STORAGE AREA FOR OUR SEVENTEEN NURSE TRAILERS, WITH AN APPROXIMATE TOTAL CAPACITY OF 75,000 POUNDS, WITH THE VESSEL FILLED TO 85% CAPACITY.

THE EMPLOYEES AT THIS COMPANY HAVE BEEN TRAINED IN PREPARATION OF A WORST CASE OR ALTERNATIVE RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  THEY UNDERSTAND THEIR DUTIES AND THEIR EMERGENCY ACTIONS THAT ARE SET FORTH AS COMPANY POLICY.  THE DISTANCE TO ENDPOINTS OF EACH OF THE POTENTIAL RELEASES, HAVE BEEN SHARED WITH LOCAL FIRST RESPONDERS AND THEY ARE PREPARED TO ASSIST US IN PROTECTING THE AREA PUBLIC RECEPTORS.

THIS COMPANY MAINTAINS AND OPERATES THEIR NH-3 PLANT IN STRICT ACCORDANCE WITH ALL STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES.  THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTS OUR PLANT ON A REGULAR BASIS AND WE COMPLY WITH THEIR REQUESTS FOR IMPROVEMENT.  THOSE CHANGES OR IMPROVEMENTS WILL BE ACTED UPON IMMEDIATELY TO REDUCE POTENTIAL AMMONIA RELEASES.

OUR EMPLOYEES ARE TRAINED IN SAFETY PROCEDURES, PROPER PLANT OPERATION, PLANT MAINTENANCE AND THE EMPLOYEES ARE COMPETENCY TESTED OVER THE TRAINING MATERIAL.  
EACH EMPLOYEE USES GOGGLES AND GLOVES DURING AMMONIA OPERATION AS WELL AS ALWAYS PROVIDING PLENTY OF SAFETY WATER DURING NURSE TANK LOADING OPERATIONS. 

WITH THE ABOVE MENTIONED TRAINING IN MIND, IT MAKES IT VERY EASY TO REPORT THAT ABSOLUTELY NO INJURY ACCIDENTS OR PROPERTY DAMAGE HAVE OCCURRED AT THIS FACILITY FOR THE PAST FIVE YEARS.

OUR EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN IS DESIGNED TO MINIMIZE THE RISKS TO EMPLOYEES, THE SURROUNDING PU

BLIC RECEPTORS AND THE AREA FIRST RESPONDERS.  THIS COMPANY PROVIDES PLANT TOURS FOR OUR LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND OUR ACTION PLAN HAS BEEN SHARED WITH THE COUNTY LOCAL EMERGENCY PLANNING COMMISSION (LEPC).  THEY ARE AWARE OF THE DANGEROUS NATURE OF NH-3, AND THEY HAVE AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY.
